column1: Nyagan (Russian: Нягань) is a town in the northwest of Khanty–Mansi Autonomous Okrug
column3: located near the Ob River and 230 kilometers (140 mi) northwest of Khanty-Mansiysk. It is named after the Nyagan-Yugan River
column4: a tributary of the Ob River. Population: 54

column1: Nyagan is one of the youngest towns in Western Siberia. It was established in 1965 as a forestry center; it is now principally a center of the petroleum and natural gas industries
column2: and was originally named Nyakh (Нях). This toponym appeared on maps in the same year
column3: but the town was renamed on August 15
column4: 1985. The town territory is a waterlogged area
column5: and the region is notable for sudden temperature drops. The railway from Yekaterinburg to the Ob region has passed through Nyagan since April 2

column1: Classified by Köppen-Geiger system as continental sub-arctic climate (Dfc)
column2: with warm-to-mild summers and long very cold winters. Precipitation is distributed over the course of the year
column3: but is somewhat more in summer.

column1: Within the framework of administrative divisions
column2: it is incorporated as the town of okrug significance of Nyagan—an administrative unit with the status equal to that of the districts. As a municipal division
column3: the town of okrug significance of Nyagan is incorporated as Nyagan Urban Okrug.
